function_call.name: emulate_interaction
function_call.arguments: {"page_description":"The website now shows a checkout page with a shopping cart overview and a form divided into sections for Customer, Address, and Payment information. The Customer section is filled with 'John Doe' and 'john.doe@example.com'. 'Country' is set to 'USA', and 'Street Address' is '123 Galaxy Way' in the Address section, but 'City', 'State', and 'Zip Code' remain empty. Payment options include Invoice, Credit Card, or PayPal, although none have been selected yet. A 'Submit' button is present for form submission. Additionally, the page displays a summary of the shopping cart, indicating a Samsung Galaxy S10 5G and its price, with options to adjust the quantity or remove the item. The navigation bar includes links to Home, Galaxy, S10, M Series, and A Series categories.","new_testing_goal":"Complete the Address details by filling in the 'City', 'State', and 'Zip Code', select a Payment method, and submit the order. Afterwards, test the navigational links to ensure they lead to the correct sections of the store.","explanation":"To complete the checkout process, we must first finish filling out the Address section. Start with filling in the 'City' field, continue with the 'State', and finally enter the 'Zip Code'. After completing the address details, select one of the Payment options. Submit the form to finalize the order. This will test the form's validation, submission process, and the functionality of the Payment method selection. Once the checkout is complete, navigate using the links in the navigation bar to test if they lead to their respective sections correctly.","interaction":{"interaction_type":"send_keys","element_id":":r42:","keys":"New York"}}

messages.content: Given a web application, you are tasked with assisting in testing its functionality. The emulate_interaction function takes an interaction as input and emulates it on the web application. The return value of the function is the new, filtered HTML source code of the web application. The source code of previous interactions will be omitted from the input to the assistant.
Here are some examples how the 'emulate_interaction' function should be used.
Please test my website: omitted

function_call.name: emulate_interaction
function_call.arguments: {"page_description": "The start page of a web site with multiple calculators for different purposes. There are buttons to navigate to the differet calculators and a button to switch the language of the web site. The current language is English.", "new_testing_goal": "Test the calculator for calculating the area of a circle in multiple languages.", "explanation": "First navigate to the calculator for the area of a circle. Then input a radius and calculate the area. Switch the language of the web site and repeat the process.", "interaction": {"interaction_type": "click", "element_id": "btn-area-circle"}}

Then switch the language of the web site and repeat the process.", "interaction": {"interaction_type": "send_keys", "element_id": "radius", "keys": "5"}}

messages.content: Please test my website. The goal is to test as many different features as possible to find potential bugs, so make sure to include edge cases. Here is the filtered HTML source code of the web application: 'omitted'.

function_call.name: emulate_interaction
function_call.arguments: {"page_description":"The website is currently displaying the checkout page in a web application focused on e-commerce, specifically for the Galaxy product line. The navigation bar includes links to Home, Galaxy, S10, M Series, and A Series. The checkout page contains a cart summary on the left, listing added items with their details such as the Samsung Galaxy S10 5G and its price. It also allows for item quantity adjustment and removal. On the right side of the page, there's a comprehensive customer information form divided into three sections: Customer, Address, and Payment. The Customer section requires a first name, last name, and email. The Address section requests country, street address, city, state, and zip code. In the Payment section, users can select between invoice, credit card, or PayPal. A 'Submit' button is available at the bottom to complete the checkout process.","new_testing_goal":"Complete the checkout process by sequentially filling out the form sections: First, fill out the Customer information starting with the first name. Next, complete the Address details, and finally, choose a payment method before submitting the form.","explanation":"To test the checkout process comprehensively, begin by filling in the customer's personal information. Start with the first name field, then proceed to the last name, and finally the email address. This step-by-step approach allows for an investigation of each field for proper validation and user feedback mechanisms. After completing the Customer section, we will continue with the Address details, followed by selecting a payment method and submitting the order.","interaction":{"interaction_type":"send_keys","element_id":":r3t:","keys":"John"}}

messages.name: emulate_interaction
messages.content: omitted

function_call.name: emulate_interaction
function_call.arguments: {"page_description":"The website is currently displaying the checkout page with sections for customer, address, and payment information. The 'Customer' section has fields for the first name (which is already filled with 'John'), last name, and email, but only the first name is filled in. The 'Address' and 'Payment' sections are still empty. There's also a button to submit the form. Aside from the form, the page shows a summary of the cart, listing a Samsung Galaxy S10 5G and its price, with options to remove items or adjust quantities.","new_testing_goal":"Complete the customer information section by entering the last name and email address.","explanation":"To continue testing the checkout process, next fill in the last name and email address in the provided fields under the 'Customer' section. This will help ensure that the form accepts input as intended and that user data is correctly handled before proceeding to the Address details. Following the completion of the Customer section, the testing will proceed to the Address and Payment sections accordingly.","interaction":{"interaction_type":"send_keys","element_id":":r3u:","keys":"Doe"}}

messages.name: emulate_interaction
messages.content: omitted

function_call.name: emulate_interaction
function_call.arguments: {"page_description":"The checkout page is currently displaying with sections for customer, address, and payment information already partially filled in. The 'Customer' section has fields for first and last names, which are completed with 'John' and 'Doe', but the email field is yet to be filled. The 'Address' and 'Payment' sections are visible but still empty, awaiting input. There's also a button to submit the form at the bottom. Aside from the form, the page shows a summary of the cart with a Samsung Galaxy S10 5G listed along with its price, and options to adjust quantities or remove items.","new_testing_goal":"Continue with filling out the Checkout form by completing the Email address, moving on to fill the Address section, choosing a payment method, and submitting the order.","explanation":"Filling in the email address is the next step. It completes the Customer information section and allows us to proceed to the Address and Payment sections. This step-by-step process ensures we're inputting data as a user would, checking for any validation or functional issues along the way. Once the email is filled, proceed to fill in the Address section fields, choose a payment method from the options provided, and then submit the order.","interaction":{"interaction_type":"send_keys","element_id":":r3v:","keys":"john.doe@example.com"}}

function_call.name: emulate_interaction
function_call.arguments: {"page_description":"The web application is currently on the checkout page, with separate sections for Customer, Address, and Payment information. The Customer section is completely filled with a first name, last name, and email address. The Address section is displayed but empty, requiring details such as Country, Street Address, City, State, and Zip Code. The Payment section offers choices between Invoice, Credit Card, or PayPal but has not been filled. A 'Submit' button is available for form submission. Additionally, a summary of the shopping cart is visible, listing a Galaxy S10 5G with its price and options to manage the cart item.","new_testing_goal":"Complete the Address details for the checkout process, choose a payment method, and attempt to submit the form.","explanation":"Start by filling the 'Country' field in the Address section, then proceed to fill in the 'Street Address', 'City', 'State', and 'Zip Code'. After completing the Address details, select a payment method from the Payment section. Finally, attempt to submit the completed form by clicking on the 'Submit' button. This will test the functionality of the checkout process by ensuring that all parts of the form work together seamlessly and validate the entered information correctly.","interaction":{"interaction_type":"send_keys","element_id":":r40:","keys":"USA"}}

function_call.name: emulate_interaction
function_call.arguments: {"page_description":"The web application has presented the checkout page, featuring sections for Customer, Address, and Payment information. The Customer section is completed, showing inputs for 'John Doe' and 'john.doe@example.com'. The Address section has been partially filled, with 'Country' set to 'USA'. Empty fields for Street Address, City, State, and Zip Code remain. The Payment section awaits selection between Invoice, Credit Card, or PayPal. There are also cart summary details, displaying a Galaxy S10 5G, its price, and options to adjust quantity or remove.","new_testing_goal":"Ensure all address information is completed, select a Payment method, and proceed to submit the checkout form. Test the checkout form submission process and explore post-submission feedback.","explanation":"Fill out the remaining fields in the Address section, starting with Street Address, followed by City, State, and Zip Code. Once the Address details are fully entered, choose one of the payment methods available. The action of filling these fields and making a selection will help assess the web application's ability to handle complete checkout processes. After completing these steps, the form should be submitted to examine the website's response to checkout submission, including any success or error messages.","interaction":{"interaction_type":"send_keys","element_id":":r41:","keys":"123 Galaxy Way"}}

Start by describing the website supplied by the function call. Give a short general description first then summarize the main elements on the website. Do not use HTML in your description. Then you may formulate a high level sub-goal to the user's instructions, that should be persued with the next couple of interactions. You should formulate a new sub-goal if the current one has been completed or seems to be unattainable. Give an action plan that explains how the goal should be reached. And finally, describe the interaction to emulate.

Only use the click action with clickable elements. The clickable elements have the following ids: :r3p:, :r0:-home, :r0:-galaxy, :r0:-s10, :r0:-m_series, :r0:-a_series, :r1:, :r2:, :r3q:, :r3r:, :r3s:. Only use the send_keys action with writable elements. The writable elements have the following ids: :r3t:, :r3u:, :r3v:, :r40:, :r41:, :r42:, :r43:, :r44:. Only use the clear action with clearable elements. The clearable elements have the following ids: :r3t:, :r3u:, :r3v:, :r40:, :r41:.

functions.name: emulate_interaction
functions.description: Emulates a user interaction with the web application

page_description.description: A short textual description of the state of the web application: What is the current page? What are the main elements on the page? This description should not contain any HTML.

new_testing_goal.description: Assigns a new high level sub-goal that shall be followed in order to complete the users instructions. This goal should take multiple user interactions to complete. The assistant shall try to complete this goal in the next couple of interactions and then assign a new one.

explanation.description: An action plan that explains how the goal should be reached.

interaction_type.description: The type of interaction to emulate

element_id.description: The id of the element to interact with

interaction_type.description: The type of interaction to emulate

element_id.description: The id of the element to interact with

keys.description: the keys to be sent to the input element

anyOf.description: sends keystrokes to an html element

interaction_type.description: The type of interaction to emulate

element_id.description: The id of the element to interact with

anyOf.description: resets the contents of an html element
